data.title: Bonaparte descendants
data.text:
This list was complied from notes I made in the 1970s from a book about the Bonaprte descendants, which I found in my university library. However, I do not remember the name of this book. Updates since the 1970s are derived from a wide variety of sources. Thanks also to Dennis Cunniff for information, some of which came from Patricia Tyson Stroud's “The Man Who Had Been King” and from further research he has done. Other information, particularly on the descendants of Joseph Bonaparte, comes from research done by Netty Leistra.

Carlo Maria Buonaparte (b.Ajaccio 1746, d.Montpellier 1785) married at Ajaccio 1764 Maria Letizia Ramolino (b.Ajaccio 1749/50, d.Rome 1836) and had issue:

1a) Joseph Bonaparte, King of Spain, etc, b.Corte 7 Jan 1768, d.Florence 28 July 1844; m.Cuges 1 Aug 1794 Julie (b.at Marseilles26 Dec 1771, d.Florence 7 Apr 1845) dau.of Francois Clary by Francoise Somis

1b) Julie Josephine Bonaparte (Genoa29 Feb 1796-Genoa6 Jun 1797)

2b) Zenaide Bonaparte, b.Paris 8 July 1801, d.Naples 8 Aug 1854; m.Brussels 29 June 1822 Charles Lucien Bonaparte (see below)

3b) Charlotte Bonaparte, b.Paris 31 Oct 1802, d.Sarzana 2 Mar 1839; m.Brussels 23 July 1826 Napoleon Bonaparte (see below)

4b) [illegitimate by Maria Giulia Colonna] Giulio N (9 Sep 1807-1836)

5b) [illegitimate by Maria Giulia Colonna] Teresa N, b.30 Sep/29 Oct 1808, d.young

6b) [illegitimate by Annette Savage, of Philadelphia] Pauline Josephe (1821-4 Dec 1825)

7b) [illegitimate by Annette Savage, of Philadelphia] Caroline Charlotte Delafolie (1822-Philadelphia/New York25 Dec 1890); m.Watertown NY 31 Jul 1839 Zebulon Howell Benton (27 Jan 1811-16 May 1893)

1d) Caroline Charlotte Hughes (Pennsylvania7 Feb 1870 [Nov 1869?]-9 Feb 1960); Note: This is almost assuredly not the Caroline Hughes who m.Samuel Krieger, as some genealogies suggest. If she were, she would have married and borne a child by the age of 14. Census records list her with her maiden name, living with a sister, in 1930
